item.title: Sprint?
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Dias:

In Half-Life 2, the players hull height is 72 units tall(& so is barney) because all of the human characters use a scale of 1 foot as being 12 units, or 1 unit equals 1 inch. (As opposed to the maps & props which use a scale of 1 foot = 16 units.)

From what I can find on the valve wiki, speed is given in map-units(i.e. inches) per second. To convert that to miles per hour, just multiply by about 0.056818. The player movement speeds according to the dev console (& cl_showpos for crawling speed) are:

HL2_normalspeed 190 (10.795455 mph)
HL2_sprintspeed 320 (18.181818 mph)
HL2_walkspeed 150 (8.522727 mph)
crawl-speed 63.33 (3.76875 mph)

There. That’s how I figured it out. I don’t need some “in-game-speedometer” to figure out what’s going on. In fact, it took me longer to explain than it did to figure out. Start up a treadmill, see if you can walk 8.5 miles an hour for more than a minute (without a HEV suit)

Or you could read this: https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dimensions#Speed

Which is official and slightly different.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprint?
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
DrGonzo:

He’s in a robot suit thing. Of course he can run really fast.

Try reading. The HL2_walkspeed is the speed you walk at if you press the alt key, or if you don’t have the suit. 8.5 mph is how fast Gordon walks without the suit.

rorriMAesU:

If you notice, you said HL2 normal speed is just about 11 mph, which you also claim is the avg human sprint speed. If that is supposed to be sprinting, how come it seems so slow in-game?

Actually I never mentioned a average sprint speed, but I think that the reason it seems so slow is because of the scale of the environments. Because movement & collision is so bulky, (the player needs a minimum of 33 inches to walk through) everything is 4/3’s the size they should be. Doorways seem taller & halls seem longer. This is probably why it seems so slow.

rorriMAesU:

Accordingly, I always wish there was a non-suit sprint in the beginning of HL2. I guess Gordon cant run unless he’s wearing an HEV suit. :facepalm:

I’m pretty sure it was a cut plot-related excuse. I’ll just link to one of my old posts: https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=239881

rorriMAesU:

Im not arguing with him, my whole point is that the speed itself is not what makes sprinting seem awkward, gordon’s weapons do not move realistically and that is why the running looks weird. Not the mention the fact that his head doesn’t really move while running, its like gordon is floating.

Basically what you’re saying is: I saw this stuff in other games, and now I want it in half-life. I will say this: when you run with a weapon down like that, there is one of three possibilities.

  1. The view model will pop up instantly when you do shoot (Ugly)
  2. There is a delay between the gun getting pulled up, and the shot being fired (Annoying)
  3. You will not be able to shoot at all. (Even more annoying)

Or the weapon is always up, but wobbles around a bit. I think this is the best solution. It really isn’t worth discussing.
